Title: Commercial Banking Intern - Summer 2021 (Phoenix, AZ)
Required Qualifications:
Req ID: 57141

Areas of Interest: Commercial Banking

BOK Financial (BOKF), Headquartered in Tulsa, Oklahoma, BOK Financial Corporation (NASDAQ: BOKF) is a top 25 U.S.-based financial services holding company with operations in ten states – Oklahoma, Texas, Arkansas, Arizona, Colorado, Kansas/Missouri, New Mexico, Nebraska and Wisconsin. The company began more than 100 years ago in Tulsa and has successfully diversified into a variety of industries, businesses and geographies. .

Base Salary Range:$55,148 - $67,403

Bonus Type: Not Bonus Eligible

Accelerated Career Track Intern - Commercial Banking

The ACT Intern Program is a summer- long intensive 10 week program, starting in May 2021.

Company Overview

Our success starts with our incredible talent, with many of our tenured employees starting out as BOKF interns. You can do the same! Our intern program has a proven tradition of excellence, including a collaborative work environment, a commitment to our communities, and a path to growth and development.

About The Role

We will invest in every aspect of your personal and professional growth in this ten-week program. We will teach you the ins and outs of financial services. You will develop your professional skills to prepare for a career with us. Internal training and self-study courses will allow you to build your skills specific to our operations, markets, and strategies. You will bring your enthusiasm, point of view, and energy to make a difference.

What You Can Expect

You’ll work with peers on process improvements or special assignments to support departments. You’ll work on special projects, make presentations, and network with people across our banking footprint. You’ll participate in Battle of the Interns to tackle a real business challenge and present your team’s findings to a panel of judges. This is an exciting and rewarding opportunity, which may result in your process improvements being implemented and impacting our bottom line.

Building relationships across all levels of the company is one of the program’s many perks. Access to senior leadership is available to everyone and something you won’t find at other companies. You will develop your skills around time management, presentation, sales, leadership, communication, and building relationships to drive outcomes. You’ll learn from managers and mentors on what it takes to build a successful career.

Team Culture

We are a goal-oriented team. We value initiative, and we care about the quality of our work. Mentorship within the team is a common practice. We take great pride in offering opportunities for our Interns and staying true to ourselves. The caring spirit we have for our coworkers allows for plenty of laughter and learning.

We understand everyone has different strengths and opportunities for growth and we strive to have the right mix of competencies in order to get the most out of the team dynamic. We act with honor and truthfulness and live our company values every day. Our foundation of integrity builds coworker trust, relationships, and effective interpersonal relationships.

How You’ll Spend Your Time
You will participate in classroom, self-study, and hands-on curriculum.
You will build relationships with managers, mentors, and peers.
You will participate in special projects, present data, analyze situations, draw conclusions, and make recommendations when required.
You will participate in Battle of the Interns on a project team.

We’d Like to Talk to You if You Have These Hard & Soft Skills

GRIT: You are committed to doing your best work and staying the course under the best and most challenging of circumstances.

RESULTS ORIENTED: You show initiative as you focus on the desired deliverables, while meeting and exceeding your goals.

TECH SAVVY: You have an innate curiosity and think deeply, rationally, and creatively with solid PC skills including spreadsheet, database, and MSOffice.

COMMUNICATION: You need exceptional verbal and written communication to express yourself clearly and concisely to internal and external clients, including C-level audiences.

PROJECT MANAGEMENT: You effectively prioritize tasks and juggle multiple priorities.

BOK Financial is a stable and financially strong organization that provides excellent training and development to support building the long term careers of our employees. With passion, skill and partnership you can make an impact on the success of the bank, our customers and your own career!

Apply today and take the first step towards your next career opportunity!

BOK Financial is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunities for training, compensation, transfer, promotion and other aspects of employment for all qualified applicants and employees without regard to sex, race, color, religion, national origin, age, disability, sexual orientation, genetic information or veteran status.

Please contact recruiting_coordinators@bokf.com with any questions.

Title: Internship - FX and Global Banking Product Intern
Required Qualifications:
As part of Silicon Valley Bank’s Commercial Bank Product Division, the FX and Global Banking Product team is responsible for products that drive growth and enable our innovation economy clients to manage their global operations. These products include foreign exchange, foreign currency account solutions and cross border payments in 90+ currencies. The FX and Global Banking team supports FX services which is the largest core fee revenue component for the Product Division.

For nearly 40 years, SVB Financial Group and its subsidiaries have helped innovators, their companies and their investors move bold ideas forward.

In this position you’ll gain real life experience in product management, relationship management and global banking in an exciting and high growth part of SVB.

Under supervision from senior team members the intern will have the exciting opportunity to work across the teams in FX and Global Banking and have exposure to various initiatives to support a high growth, global business.

Work as part of a team and participate in projects that may include the following
Analyze problems and use data and reports to recommend solutions
Prepare presentations on various initiatives and topics
Participate in team meetings and internal calls with other groups to learn about various roles and functions within the team and broader organization

Special Projects
Work on initiatives to improve administration and efficiency global bank network management


Qualifications
Candidates must be students currently enrolled in a college/university
Open to all majors (finance, economics or international business preferred)
Seeking Undergrad or Masters level students
Candidate should have a minimum GPA of 3.5 (preferred)
Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills
Strong organizational and time management skills

Title: Portfolio Management Internship (2021)
Required Qualifications:
Byline Bank, a leader in small business and government-guaranteed lending, is the one of the Top 10 Small Business Administration 7(a) lenders and a leading USDA lender in the United States.

Byline Bank is currently seeking an Intern for the Portfolio Manager department that is available throughout the year. The Internship program will give an in-depth exposure to the world of commercial banking, specifically from a leader in the area of Small Business lending.

Byline specializes in providing small business owners with solutions to make their dreams come true. You will also have the opportunity to sit in on weekly department meetings and various trainings. You will work directly with senior leaders across Byline to help guide your focus for the future!

Portfolio Management Intern

As a Portfolio Manager Intern you will be responsible for providing various servicing and administrative support duties as the Portfolio Management Team’s liaison on assigned loan accounts.

Key Responsibilities
Update dates/valuations in nCino portal such as appraisal and site visits.
Upload documents into nCIno portal to include: financial statements, certificates of insurance, appraisals, site visit reports, WAR reports and servicing actions
Enter financial reporting requirements for new loans assigned to PM group and existing loans in PM group.
Aid with the financial statement collections and notifications: issue mass email for staff members.
Assist in gathering documentation needed, as well as, ordering site visits and equipment appraisals from third party vendors.
Ordering environmental reports.
Aide in clearing exceptions in purchase demand kits (title policies, life insurance policies and UCC releases).
Update nCino when a new account is assigned to a PM.
Account transfers submissions.
Pulling Loan Statements or Deposit Statements for Borrowers.
Processing Wire Requests for our borrowers and getting signed wire agreements with our borrowers.
Order tract/title searches for servicing actions (i.e. releases and refiles).


Qualifications
Junior or senior majoring in Finance or Accounting.
Strong written communication skills required.
Ability to work independently.
Strong organization skills; ability to multi-task.
Detail-oriented and accuracy a must.
Confident in a professional office environment.

Join a highly motivated, dedicated group of people with a team collaboration approach to work. Byline Bank is a fast-paced, growing organization where team members take pride in their work and enjoy the organization’s successes together.

Byline is an Equal Opportunity Employer and encourages veterans, women, minorities, and people with disabilities to apply. If you require reasonable accommodation during any part of the hiring process, please submit requests directly to applicant@bylinebank.com.

Title: Relationship Management Intern

Description

At First Republic, we care about our people. Founded in 1985, we offer extraordinary client service in private banking, private business banking and private wealth management. We believe that personal connections are everything and our success is driven by the relationships we form with our colleagues and clients. You'll always feel empowered and valued here.

Putting you first
As an intern, you will gain hands-on experience at a high-growth company that values its people. You'll earn a competitive starting wage while absorbing a culture that emphasizes collaboration, entrepreneurial thinking and quick decision-making. Start doing the best work of your life here.

Responsibilities

Relationship Management
As an intern, you'll work closely with Relationship Managers and Bankers with their day-today tasks, with a focus on taking care of existing clients and supporting new client relationships. You will gain exposure to other departments as you partner with them to deliver extraordinary service to our clients.

What You'll Do As a Relationship Management Intern
Provide direct support to Relationship Managers on administrative duties related to portfolio management.
Collaborate with marketing to leveraging existing client touchpoints, from events to holiday cards to marketing mailers.
Partner with our Eagle Intelligence team to identify new ways to serve our existing clients.
Help track results from business development efforts using a variety of tools.
Assist with administrative tasks including but not limited to business expense requests, team event planning and list management.
Qualifications

You could be a great fit if you have:
Service-centered mindset with an ability to problem-solve independently and collaborate effectively with others.
Strong verbal and written communication skills.
Superior attention to detail and ability to manage multiple tasks concurrently.
Discretion with confidential information.
Proficient in Microsoft Office (Outlook, Word, Excel).
Two years of undergraduate experience in finance, economics, business administration or similar
Job Demands
Must be able to review and analyze data reports and manuals; must be computer proficient.
Must be able to communicate effectively via telephone and in person.
Own your work and your career - apply now
Are you willing to take initiative and make decisions? Are you willing to go the extra mile because you love what you do and how you can contribute as a team? Do you want the freedom to grow and the opportunity to take charge of your own career? If so, then come join us.

We want hard working team players. You'll have the independence to learn, lead and drive change. A culture of extraordinary service, empowerment and stability - that's the First Republic way.

This job description is not intended to be all-inclusive. Employee may perform other related duties as assigned to meet the ongoing needs of the organization. EDUCATION And/or EXPERIENCE

Major related to the position the applicant is applying preferred

Address

3348 Peachtree Rd NE

Job Family Group

Facilitates decisioning and analysis of all types of credit information to support lending decisions and processes for the bank. Maintains and promotes a client service environment to satisfy and exceed customer needs and expectations. This role will make credit decisions and recommendations in accordance with sound credit-granting principles and in compliance with Bank Policies & Procedures.

Provides advice and guidance to assigned business/group on implementation of solutions.
Breaks down strategic problems, and analyses data and information to provide insights and recommendations.

Builds effective relationships with internal/external stakeholders.

Works mostly independently.

Excellent capability to independently and proactively service multiple clients.
Specialized knowledge from education and/or business experience.
Verbal & written communication skills - In-depth.
Collaboration & team skills - In-depth.
Analytical and problem solving skills - In-depth.
Influence skills - In-depth.

Title: Bank Operations Intern
Company: Federal Home Loan Bank of New York
Required Qualifications:
The Bank Operations intern will be primarily assigned to projects and tasks related to the daily operation and future goals of the Credit Operations department. They will also be asked to assist in other areas within Bank Operations (Electronic Payments, Custody and Pledging).
Credit Operations functions will include daily Municipal Letter of Credit (MULOC) processing and, if on-site, Robotic processing of Credit of Credit mailing labels, as well as assistance with Merger and Stand-by Letter of Credit processing.

Essential Duties
Municipal Letter of Credit (MULOC) processing, including new request and renewal processing
Robotic Process Automation (RPA) testing of the FedEx Letter of Credit BOT, including active participation in ongoing robotic efforts related to the MULOC renewal process.
Assist with the coordination of any/all Merger transactions
Assist with Stand-by Letter of Credit underwriting efforts, including new and/or amendment requests
Daily Rate distribution to our member banks
Assist with Global Authorization Form processing and corresponding User entitlements
Perform associated data analysis to support /enhance project efforts
Familiarize themselves with Bank Operation's workflow diagram mappings
Familiarize themselves with test script documentation and perform User Acceptance Testing (UAT)
Other Duties
Review Members' margin letters for verification in the Bank's Collateral System
Requirements

Education -
Two years college in a related major - Finance, Business Administration, Accounting
Skills-
Proficiency in Microsoft suite of Office products. Responsibility, Dependability, and Reliability. Must be a self-starter and fast learner willing to learn and able to multi-task.

The Candidate Should Possess The Following Abilities
write and speak professionally
communicate effectively
build and maintain relationships
collaborate with others
manage time effectively
critical thinking
take initiative
be receptive and willing to learn
Experience-
General work experience in a fast-paced environment. Experience and/or an interest in the Banking/Financial industry is preferred, but not required
Due to the Covid-19 environment, the intern may be required to work remotely full time.

Ability to manage multiple tasks and complete quickly with accuracy

Title: Intern - Commercial Credit
Required Qualifications:
The 2021 OceanFirst Bank Summer Internship Program is a paid, part-time program for undergraduate college/university students located at our modern headquarters on the shores of the Navesink River in Red Bank, NJ. The 12-week internship gives students an opportunity to gain valuable work experience in their majors and explore the banking industry while also learning about the OceanFirst culture and core values. The summer internship begins on June 1, 2020 and concludes in mid-August.

PRIMARY PURPOSE: Develop knowledge and understanding of the internal operations of the Banking Industry, specifically within our Commercial Credit Department. Participate in the execution of daily operational tasks to learn and understand the workflow and processes of critical business and banking functions. Assist the commercial credit department in its role of underwriting commercial loans. The intern would assist with spreads, cash flows and leasetracks used in the pre-screening of new commercial loan customers. Involvement in data integrity projects within nCino.

Essential Duties And Responsibilities

Under guidance and direction of various subject matter experts, contribute to the execution of department specific projects and initiatives through data collection, research, analysis and administrative support.
Gather information from a variety of sources; prepare analytic reports and summary presentations for management use in formulating recommendations.
Develop an understanding of processes and procedures. Share insights and recommendations for potential enhancements and efficiencies. Participate in documenting department processes and procedures.
Develop a knowledge and understanding of the Banking Industry that includes both the customer experience and the inter-relationships of various internal functional departments.
Support technical and analytical efforts to improve the quality, reliability and usefulness of data.
Successfully contribute to the achievement of assigned department objectives.
Completion of financial statement spreads within nCino.
Assist in the preparation of personal and business cash flows for commercial lending customers as well as leasetrack analysis, all within Excel.
Assist with various projects as needed within nCino in order to ensure that all commercial loan information is correctly populated in the system.

Job Specifications

Knowledge, Skills & Abilities

Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Ability to work effectively with various departments
Problem solving and analytical skills
Organizational skills with the ability to multi-task
Proficiency in Microsoft Outlook, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint

Experience & Education

Pursuing Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Finance or Economics or related field

Working Conditions/Physical Requirements

Title: Business Banking Credit Analyst Intern (86144)
Required Qualifications:
Position Summary

Assist the Bank's Business Bankers in the timely and objective analysis of new and existing extensions of credit. This would include research and gathering of financial information, writing credit reviews and recommendations, working with customers regarding financial information, working directly with the Business Banking Officers, tracking financial information and presenting to loan committees. This person must be able to interact professionally with internal and external persons at all levels. The expectation is this position will grow into a Business Banking Representative/Officer (sales).

Responsibilities
Complete credit reviews for existing and prospective borrowers to assist in the underwriting process. Assist in the timely presentation of these credit reviews to the appropriate approval authority, as required by the Lending Policy.
Contact customers for financial information.
Assist in the tracking and timely completion of annual credit reviews, as required by the Lending Policy.
In the annual review process, make respective lender aware of outstanding exceptions related to the subject relationship. Also, review collateral documentation to ensure accuracy in comparison to the approved structure. As needed, conduct UCC and/or Real Estate Title Searches on those credits that have been identified for potential lien position risks. Order Appraisals.
Assist in the tracking, collection and spreading of Borrower's Business Financial Statements and Personal Financial Statements, as required by each lending arrangement determined by the respective Lender.
Document the minutes for the Bank's Credit Committee to ensure accuracy during the approval process.
Complete real estate appraisal reviews and real estate evaluations as required by appraisal review policy.
Attend the Loan Committee Meetings.
Prepare SBA applications and ensure SBA compliance
Other tasks as assigned
Adheres to the bank's Code of Ethics
Competencies

Qualifications
Honesty, Integrity and Ethics - honesty and integrity is the ability to act in a fair and just manner, free from deception; ethics is the ability to be guided by the company's accepted principles of moral conduct
Accountability - the extend to which an individual is willing to accept responsibility
Adaptability - the extent to which an individual can fit into a changing working environment.
Decision Making - the ability to select an effective course of action while controlling resources and expenditures
Interpersonal / Customer Oriented - the ability to develop and maintain relationships with others. The desire to serve both external and internal clients by focusing effort on meeting the client's needs, understanding their concerns and seeking to build trust
Analytical Skills - the ability to gather data and process it into a meaningful form
Written Communication - the ability to write concise, clear letter and report, including proofing and editing
Financial Aptitude - the ability to understand and explain economic and accounting information
Accuracy - the level of which am individual's work is error free within the company policies and guidelines
Organized - the ability to be structured and methodical in working skills
Relationship Building - the ability to establish and maintain a good rapport and cooperative relationship with customers and co-workers
Working under pressure = the ability to maintain composure when exposed to stress
Results oriented - the ability to drive behaviors to emphasize achievement. The ability to be self-directed towards accomplishments, be action oriented, enjoy challenges, and pursue opportunities
Skills/Knowledge/Abilities
Bachelors Degree in Accounting ,Finance or Economics preferred
A minimum of 6 months experience in credit or as Credit intern
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Strong interpersonal skills
Proficient computer skills (Microsoft Word, Power Point and Excel)
Excellent organizational skills
Ability to handle self professionally with all levels of clients
Attention to detail
This job description does not constitute an exhaustive list of responsibilities and management may revise at any time

Title: Internship for Private Equity Corporate Development
Required Qualifications:
Seeking strong candidates for virtual, remote work internships in Corporate Development for El Toro Capital Management (ETC), an inaugural $250MM Private Equity Fund based in Santa Monica, CA. ETC is a spinout of New Century Capital Partners (NCCP), which is one of the premier investment banks in California and was voted “Most Influential in Los Angeles Finance” for 2017 and 2018 by the Los Angeles Business Journal.
 The ETC/NCCP Intern-Analyst Program in Corporate Development for Private Equity provides an intensive, unpaid 6-month internship providing a unique opportunity to (1) further develop analytical, communication and problem-solving skills and (2) take on meaningful responsibility in real-world corporate development assignments. Intern-Analysts will be directly involved in new corporate development efforts for the private equity fund and gain direct exposure to company management teams and Senior Managing Directors. In addition, Intern-Analysts will gain exposure to Investment Banking activities through NCCP.
 Intern-Analysts will be heavily involved in the following:
 Market research and industry analysis for Private Equity

Direct calling, emailing and marketing to management teams of emerging and leading Technology companies

Creating and managing company and industry databases

Developing corporate presentations and industry analyses

Performing financial analysis of Technology companies in Cybersecurity, Digital Media and SaaS Software

Specific learning modules on various topics in Private Equity and Investment Banking
 ETC/NCCP offers Intern-Analysts a unique environment that combines a highly entrepreneurial platform focused on assisting in advising and financing some of the world's leading growth companies in Technology sector, with the analytical rigor generally only available at the largest private equity firms and investment banks on Wall Street.
 The ETC/NCCP Intern-Analyst Program is one of the longest standing and most successful on Wall Street. Previous ETC/NCCP Intern-Analysts are now working at some of the world's most prestigious investment banks and private equity firms, including: Goldman Sachs, Morgan Stanley, Credit Suisse, Deutsche Bank, JP Morgan, Lazard, Jefferies, Guggenheim Partners, Merrill Lynch, The Gores Group, Bain Capital, Silver Lake Partners and J.H. Whitney & Co.
 Position Requirements:
 Strong verbal and written communication skills

Proficient in MS Outlook, Excel, PowerPoint and Word

Proficient in finding/researching information on the Internet

Superior leadership skills and capacity to facilitate cross-functional initiative

Highly motivated, pro-active self-starter in an aggressive team-oriented environment

Capacity to think “outside of the box” and contribute to creative solutions

Self-starter with the self-discipline to work extended periods without being micro-managed

Very strong work ethic and willingness to do add value to growing companies with a positive attitude!
 Process Information:
 The ETC/NCCP Intern-Analyst Program is an unpaid full-time internship position and is for a flexible period of 6 months, with a start date of May 19, 2021.

The ETC/NCCP Intern-Analyst Program is virtual, working from home via video conferencing for the entire duration of the internship.

We must receive your resume for this position by 5:00pm PT on Monday, April 12, 2021.
